quest.name: Tidings from the East
journal: Lyse has tidings to share with you.

Lyse is busy apprising you of recent developments in Ala Mhigo when Alphinaud and Alisaie arrive bearing word from Tataru. Apparently, Hancock has acquired information of great interest and no small amount of urgency, leaving you little choice but to set out at once for the offices of the East Aldenard Trading Company in distant Kugane.

At the Ruby Bazaar, Hancock shares a tantalizing rumor: that individuals resembling Gosetsu and Yotsuyu were but recently seen walking the streets of Kugane. Though you struggle to comprehend how they could possibly have escaped Doma Castle alive, the fact remains that the Garleans were sufficiently convinced to dispatch a sizable contingent of soldiers to hunt them down. Never one to leave a comrade at an enemy's mercy, you agree to join Yugiri in her quest for the truth.
Ever eager to help, Hancock has taken the liberty of employing “one of the finest informants money can buy” to aid in the search. He awaits you in the back streets of Sanjo Hanamachi...

To no one's surprise, the informant turns out to be Gyodo, the Namazu who unwisely betrayed you to the Empire during your first visit to Kugane. Promising no more funny business, he shares a promising lead: an elderly Roegadyn samurai recently sold a katana of surpassing craftsmanship to a pawnbroker on Kogane Dori. While Alisaie accompanies Gyodo to a meeting with his imperial connections, you and the others will seek out the pawnbroker to ascertain whether the weapon in question did indeed belong to Gosetsu.
objectives: Head to the Ruby Bazaar offices in Kugane.
Speak with Alisaie in Sanjo Hanamachi.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Forename! Great timing! I was just about to send word to the Scions. I've got lots to tell you!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: The council has officially recognized the Resistance as our standing army. And I expect you can guess who's been appointed commander. Suffice it to say, we're in good hand!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Having the Bull of Ala Mhigo at the helm's done wonders for morale. People were dancing in the streets when the announcement was made. And we have you and the sultana to thank for it. If you two hadn't worked your magic, he'd never have contemplated following his heart.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: The council has also decreed that we're to maintain a presence at Rhalgr's Reach. Lyse will continue to lead our forces in the Fringes─a job she's been doing tirelessly. A bit too tirelessly, some might say. We're constantly having to remind her to rest before she falls over.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: That's an exaggeration─and I always get up again. Anyway, we can hardly afford to lower our guard now. Not after our latest brush with Lakshmi. Speaking of which, we've been keeping a close eye on the Qalyana, and it looks like they've chosen a new leader.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: It's, um...Shanti's daughter. You know, the half-dead one. For whatever reason, the Qalyana thought she was the best candidate. Which makes them leaderless, basically.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: As things stand, there's no prospect of engaging in talks, let alone coming to an understanding.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: But I won't let that stop me. I'll keep on reaching out to them until they finally see sense.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Just like I've been reaching out to Fordola. She still won't meet my gaze, but she's given up trying to ignore me. It may only be the odd grunt, but at least she's responding. I'll get through to her yet.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Forename, there you are!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Alphinaud, Alisaie! Is everything all right?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We've received word from Tataru. Hancock has apparently acquired information of great interest and urgency. More than that she didn't say─only that we should come to Kugane right away.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I had a mind for the two of us to set forth together, but Alisaie is determined to make it a party of three.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: As I've told you more than a dozen times, Brother, my wounds are quite healed, and I would benefit from some fresh air. Besides, you may well need an extra pair of hands.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Worry not, Sister, I have quite given up trying to convince you.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Whether we be two or three, we should depart as soon as possible. You will be joining us, I trust?

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Huh. I was about to say I'd come too, but I'll just have to settle for cheering you on from afar. Good luck with...whatever it turns out to be!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Thank you, Lyse. Rest assured, should this business prove to be of even tangential concern to Ala Mhigo, we shall inform you without delay.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Let us be off, then. Hancock and Tataru await us at the Ruby Bazaar offices.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Give Tataru a hug from me, all right?

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: I hope all goes well in Kugane. Safe travels.

dialogue.name: EATCASSISTANT
dialogue.text: Greetings, honored madamsir. May I show you in?

dialogue.name: SCENE00006
dialogue.text: Enter the Ruby Bazaar offices?

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: The informant awaits your pleasure in the back streets of Sanjo Hanamachi. From its shining facade to its dark underbelly, few know Kugane as intimately as he.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: “One of the finest informants money can buy”... Why do I have a bad feeling about this?

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: Permit me to assist you in your quest, my friends. The sooner your business is concluded, the sooner we may speak of mine!

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: Should your search take you away from Kugane, my boat is at your disposal. I shall see that she is ready to sail.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: I'll give Soroban a hand. If he's providing us a ship, the least we can do is supply the provisions. We'll be at the pier if you need us.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: A welcome offer and an excellent plan. Without further ado, then, let us seek out this informant in Sanjo Hanamachi.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: As I mentioned, the informant awaits your pleasure in the back streets of Sanjo Hanamachi. I can confidently vouch for the quality of his intelligence...if little else.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Given the Empire's movements, it seems highly probable that Gosetsu and Yotsuyu were indeed in Kugane. Yet I can offer no explanation as to why they should be together.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: You have had dealings with informants in this city, have you not? Perchance you are already acquainted with this one.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: This should be the place. Now we wait and see who comes.

dialogue.name: GYODO
dialogue.text: (-???-)I-It has been a while, my friends. Yes, yes, a long while indeed.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: <sigh> I knew it.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Gyodo─any funny business, and you know what will happen, I trust?

dialogue.name: GYODO
dialogue.text: No, no! No funny business! Only loyal service and the finest-quality information! O-Of course...such quality does not come cheap...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: ...No. But then Hancock already paid you. Honestly, you must think we were born yesterday. I've half a mind to call Lyse.

dialogue.name: GYODO
dialogue.text: No, no! No Lyse, I beg you! No boots! I will tell you everything I know─free of charge!

dialogue.name: GYODO
dialogue.text: The Empire searches for Yotsuyu. High and low, far and wide. Come to enlist my help, they did, promising rich rewards for decisive information.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: And have you decisive information? Were the two individuals sighted here indeed Gosetsu and Yotsuyu?

dialogue.name: GYODO
dialogue.text: Alas, see them with my own eyes, I did not. But the imperials are confident. Yes, yes, very confident indeed. Look at the size of their contingent!

dialogue.name: GYODO
dialogue.text: But here is something they do not know... A rumor which you will find most interesting, I think. They say an elderly Roegadyn samurai appeared on Kogane Dori with a beauteous maiden, and sold his katana to a pawnbroker. 'Twas no common katana either, but one of surpassing craftsmanship.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Well, that is interesting─assuming it's true. Did you corroborate the rumor with the pawnbroker in question?

dialogue.name: GYODO
dialogue.text: Ah, er...no. Regrettably, I do not have a working relationship with the master of Shofuku Shichiten...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Now why would that be, I wonder. If I didn't know better, I'd think he'd lent you money...

dialogue.name: GYODO
dialogue.text: Ahem! H-He will help you, I am certain! While you speak with him, I will make contact with my Garlean connections and learn what I can of their progress.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: A glimpse of the blade is all I need to be sure. But is it wise to let the Namazu out of our sight?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Can we trust Gyodo?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: What choice do we have?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No, he'll betray us.

dialogue.name: GYODO
dialogue.text: No other choice but this! And a fine choice it is! Though I am adept at gathering information, it is so much more efficient to share the work!

dialogue.name: GYODO
dialogue.text: No, no! No more betrayals! No more boots! To divide our forces is simply more efficient!

dialogue.name: GYODO
dialogue.text: D-Do not glare at me so, I beg you. To divide our forces is simply more efficient!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text:
He's right. Given the urgency, we would do well to split up.
And so I will go with our friend here. Nothing improves efficiency like a little supervision.

dialogue.name: GYODO
dialogue.text: You─ But─ Er...yes. Yes, yes. We will go together. And there will be no boots!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Let's be about it, then. Good luck with the katana. Shall we reconvene at the pier later on? Fragrant as the Ruby Bazaar offices are, I prefer the fresh air.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I believe Alisaie has her task well in hand. Shall we seek out the pawnbroker?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have learned the emote Greeting!
